home.welcomeMessage: Use the navigation above to manage routes and extract timetables from Train Sim World.
home.gettingStartedDesc: Learn how to use the TSW HUD PROJECT to track your train journeys.
home.instruction1Intro: Use OCR to automatically extract timetable data from Train Sim World screenshots.
home.instruction2Intro: Build a timetable from scratch by entering each stop manually.
home.instruction3Intro: Import previously exported timetables or share timetables with others.
home.instruction4Intro: Record GPS coordinates for your timetable by running the route in Train Sim World while connected to the HUD Project.
home.instruction5Intro: Automatically record coordinates for your timetable entries while the AI drives the route for you. This explanation sounds more complicated than it is - a video tutorial will be added soon.
home.instruction6Intro: View your live train position on the map while playing Train Sim World.

instructions.captureScreenshotsDesc: In Train Sim World, open your timetable and take screenshots of:
instructions.timetableHeader: The timetable header showing the service name and times
instructions.timetableEntries: The detailed timetable entries showing stops, platforms, and times
instructions.uploadImagesStep2: In the "Extract from Images" section, click or drag your screenshots into the upload area
instructions.uploadImagesStep3: The system will automatically process the images using OCR
instructions.reviewDataStep1: Review the extracted timetable entries in the table
instructions.reviewDataStep2: Click on any cell to edit if the OCR made mistakes
instructions.reviewDataStep3: Ensure the Action type is correctly selected for each row
instructions.reviewDataStep4: Check that times are in HH:MM:SS format (e.g., 16:13:00)
instructions.completeTimetableStep1: Enter or verify the Service Name
instructions.completeTimetableStep2: Select a Route from the dropdown
instructions.completeTimetableStep3: Select at least one Train for this service
instructions.importantFirstLocation: The first location and first platform are not included in the in-game timetable screenshots and will need to be added manually. This data can be added after creating the timetable without any issues.
instructions.startNewTimetableStep2: Click the "+ Create New Timetable" button
instructions.enterBasicInfoStep1: Enter the Service Name (e.g., "1C84 London Paddington to Penzance")
instructions.enterBasicInfoStep2: Select the Route from the dropdown
instructions.enterBasicInfoStep3: Select one or more Trains that can run this service
instructions.addEntriesDesc: Click "+ Add Entry" to add stops. For each entry:
instructions.addEntriesAction: Action: Select the type (WAIT FOR SERVICE, STOP AT LOCATION, LOAD PASSENGERS, etc.)
instructions.addEntriesPlatform: Platform: Enter the platform number if applicable
instructions.addEntriesQuickAdd: Use the "Quick Add Common Entries" buttons to quickly add preset actions.
instructions.saveTimetableDesc: Click "Create Timetable" when all entries are added.
instructions.tipEditLater: You can always edit the timetable later by clicking on it in the timetables list.
instructions.importingStep2: In the "Import Timetable" section, click or drag a JSON file into the upload area
instructions.importingStep3: The system will validate and import the timetable automatically
instructions.importingStep4: You'll be redirected to the timetable view on success
instructions.exportingStep1: Open any timetable from the list
instructions.exportingStep3: Save the JSON file to share or backup
instructions.tipJsonExport: JSON exports include all timetable data including coordinates, making them perfect for backups or sharing complete routes.
instructions.openRecordMapStep1: Go to the Record Map page
instructions.openRecordMapStep2: Select your Route from the dropdown
instructions.openRecordMapStep5: Select the Timetable you want to record
instructions.startRecordingStep1: Start Train Sim World and load your service
instructions.startRecordingStep2: Click the "Start" button on the Record Map page
instructions.startRecordingStep3: Begin driving your route - coordinates will be recorded automatically
instructions.startRecordingStep4: The map will show your path in real-time
instructions.saveStationPositionsDesc: As you arrive at each station:
instructions.saveStationPositionsStep1: Select the station from the "Select Station" dropdown
instructions.saveStationPositionsStep2: Click "Save Position" to record the coordinates
instructions.saveStationPositionsStep3: The station will be marked with a green marker on the map
instructions.completeRecordingStep1: When finished, click "Save" to process and save all data
instructions.completeRecordingStep2: The recording will be processed and saved to the database
instructions.completeRecordingStep3: Click "Reset" to clear and start fresh if needed
instructions.automaticDesc: Recording auto-stops after 4 minutes of no movement
instructions.manualDesc: Recording continues until you click Save
instructions.tipPause: Use the "Pause" button if you need to take a break during recording. Resume when ready to continue.
instructions.inGameSetupStep4: Take a screenshot of the service name
instructions.inGameSetupStep6: Do not touch any train controls
instructions.inGameSetupStep8: Take screenshots of the schedule (multiple if needed)
instructions.inTheAppStep4: Upload your screenshots to the Timetables page
instructions.importantScreenshotOrder: The order of screenshots matters! They need to be in chronological order. If your screenshots have timestamps and you followed the flow above, you will be fine.
instructions.completeTimetableDataStep1: Go to Route Map to get the first location name and platform number
instructions.completeTimetableDataStep2: Add the location name and platform number to the timetable
instructions.completeTimetableDataStep3: Review and confirm the data - the "Service Name" often has OCR errors, but timetable data is usually accurate
instructions.startAutoRecordingStep2: Select your route, train, and timetable
instructions.enableAIDriverStep1: Use God Mode to access the console commands
instructions.enableAIDriverStep2: Enable the "Relinquish Service" command from the God Mode menu
instructions.enableAIDriverStep4: Come back when automatic recording is complete
instructions.loadTimetableStep1: Go to the Tracking Map page
instructions.loadTimetableStep2: In the "Load Timetable" section, select your Route
instructions.loadTimetableStep3: Select the Train Class and Train
instructions.loadTimetableStep4: Select a Timetable (only timetables with recorded coordinates will appear)
instructions.viewLiveTrackingDesc: Once connected to Train Sim World:
instructions.viewLiveTrackingOrange: Your train position appears as an orange marker
instructions.viewLiveTrackingBlue: The route path is shown as a blue line
instructions.viewLiveTrackingGreen: Station stops are marked with green circles
instructions.viewLiveTrackingInfo: The info panel shows your current speed and direction
instructions.timetableInfoNextStop: Next Stop Time: Scheduled time for the next station
instructions.timetableInfoDistance: Distance: Distance remaining to the next stop
instructions.followModeStep1: Click "Follow Train" to keep the map centered on your position
instructions.followModeStep2: Click "Stop Following" to browse the map freely
instructions.tipOpenHUD: Click "Open HUD" to open a dedicated heads-up display window that you can position alongside your game.
instructions.stopDetectionDesc1: Each stop (including the first) must be recorded stopped for a minimum of 30 seconds to be identified as a stop
instructions.stopDetectionDesc2: If the train doesn't move for around 5 minutes (usually at the last stop), the server will automatically stop recording, identify all stops based on timing, and save everything to the database
instructions.benefitDesc: This method lets you enjoy all the data that comes from a full route recording without having to sit through the entire journey!

settings.title: Settings
settings.networkUrlNote: Use the Network URL to access the dashboard from other devices on the same network.
settings.themeDesc: Choose between dark and light mode
settings.colorSchemeDesc: Adjust button colors for color vision accessibility
settings.selectTswVersionDesc: Choose which Train Sim World version to use for API connection
settings.apiKeyOverrideDesc: Manually enter API key (overrides path settings)
settings.apiKeyOverrideNote: If set, this key will be used instead of reading from the file path
settings.enterApiKey: Enter API key or leave empty to use path
settings.contributorNameDesc: Your name will be added to timetables you create or add coordinates to
settings.apiSubscriptionsDesc: View and manage TSW API subscriptions

huds.title: HUD Displays
huds.mobileDesc: Full-featured HUD optimized for smartphones in landscape orientation. Large touch targets and simplified station selector for one-handed operation.
huds.mobileBest1: Samsung Galaxy S23 and similar phones
huds.tabletDesc: Comprehensive HUD with all telemetry data visible at once. Includes station selector with scroll support and detailed brake information.
huds.tabletBest1: Samsung Tab S9 FE and similar tablets
huds.desktopDesc: Same layout as Tablet HUD, designed for use on a secondary monitor or browser window alongside the game on PC.
huds.experimentDesc: Minimal canvas-based HUD with a compact speedometer design. Used for testing new layouts and features before rolling out to other HUDs.

weather.enterPresetName: Enter a name for this preset:

weatherPresets.noPresets: No presets found. Add one above!

apiSubscriptions.title: API Subscription Management
apiSubscriptions.resetNote: Resetting subscriptions will disconnect and reconnect to the TSW CommAPI. This is useful if the game was restarted or if data is not updating properly.
apiSubscriptions.liveDataPreviewDesc: Preview of current subscription data from TSW:
apiSubscriptions.subscriptionEndpointsDesc: The following endpoints are subscribed when active:
